description.p: Fedy lets you install multimedia codecs and additional software that Fedora doesn't want to ship, like mp3 support, Adobe Flash, Oracle Java etc., and much more with just a few clicks.
You can perform operations from the command line, and even use it in scripts to automate tasks.
The downloaded files are saved in a folder named "fedy_dl" in your home directory, so that you can use them on another computer, or if you need to reinstall Fedora, without having to redownload.
Fedy is extensible via plugins. Writing a plugin is easy and fun.
